TopicTitle: Need Ability to Relay Comms Between Satellites/Landers, etc.

Articles.Content:
I'm no longer able to link/relay communication systems. In KSP 1, it was possible to extend the reach of my communication network by bouncing the connection off of satellites w/ large radar dishes. Now, if my Tylo lander does not have a ridiculously large radar dish, I won't be able to transmit data down to Kerbin (even though I have satellites with sufficiently large radar dishes in the immediate area). 

Is this a bug? Intentional?
CommNet is not fully implemented yet.

I agree, I found that it was not implemented yet from some looking into it, and then confirmed it here with someone else bringing it up. I really hope CommNet is implemented soon, at least as a toggle in the game settings at start. Deep space missions are hampered by every vessel needing to carry very large dishes. I feel having drone satellites lose connectivity and be uncontrollable due to poor mission planning or lack of creating a CommNet network both makes things feel more "Kerbal" when it goes wrong, and incentivizes and rewards careful planning and good play.

@BrooklynDaMoth I wouldn't worry about needing to toggle it on in a menu. I am positive that the reason it isn't implemented yet is gonna be that it hasn't been made yet. I'm sure that the second the feature works and is stable (or stable enough) it will be added.
Didn't Nertea say that Comnet is more powerful now? every antenna is a relay and line of sight is not needed.
